channel.title: Rest In Peace Jordan
channel.description:
Two days ago while I was at work, my boss got a phonecall saying that Jordan Fowles had passed away in a motorbike accident. Now the reason we got this phonecall is because Jordan worked at the same place as me. He was kind of like an older brother. At first I didn't believe this was true, untill Jordan's best friend Scott came into work crying. Jordan was a close friend to all but I was good friends with him because we worked together and I had known him from primary school.
What had happened was ever since he was 5 Jordan wanted a motorbike. Then now that he had gotten his license he was allowed to drive one. So his dad bought him one that day. He was excited about it and was driving it around town all day. He was going home on some sharp quornered roads, behind a truck. A sharp quorner came out of no where and the truck slowed down a fair ammout. Knowing he cauldn't slow down in time Jordan tried to slip past the truck. He clipped his motorbike on the truck and was thrown off onto the side of the road. He broke his neck so he wouldn't be able to walk. But he was flown to the city hospital and died there of internal bleeding.
I had never cried in public before and didn't think I would. But when the announced it on assembly (parade, aka school meeting) I cauldn't help it. All the people who where close to Jordan went to the library where you had the choice to talk to a guidence officer if you wanted. But we went there and talked about the good memories of Jordan. It was a sad day for everyone. Because he was friends with everyone and he was the kindest guy I knew. All I can say is he will be missed by all. Rest in peace Jordan.
I am not doing this for attention, I am posting this to get how I feel out. And let him be remembered maybe by more then just where he lived. Here is a picture of him when he was on school camp, he looks a bit dorky in the second one but it's the only pictures I had of him on my computer at this time, by the way there two image of him put together:
[img]http://www.sylvion.com/pictures/jordan.jpg[/img]

item.title: Rest In Peace Jordan
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

1337h4x:

If I ever lost someone I knew, I’d be sad, yes, but I wouldn’t go around telling the world.

Because this Community obviously makes up the whole world…

Sorry to here Zandia.

RIP Jordan.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Yeah, people don’t really realize it, but life can grab you by the tail and toss you out very unexpectedly. RIP

item.title: Rest In Peace Jordan
item.dc:creator: @Kori Kori
item.description:
@Kori wrote:

I had never cried in public before and didn't think I would. But when the announced it on assembly (parade, aka school meeting) I [b]cauldn't[/b] help it. All the people who where close to Jordan went to the library where you had the choice to talk to a [b]guidence[/b] officer if you wanted. But we went there and talked about the good memories of Jordan. It was a sad day for everyone. Because he was friends with everyone and he was the kindest guy I knew. All I can say is he will be missed by e was going home on some sharp [b]quornered[/b] roads, behind a truck. A sharp [b]quorner[/b] came out of no where and the truck slowed down a fair [b]ammout[/b]. Knowing he [b]cauldn't[/b] slow down in time Jordan tried to slip past the truck. He clipped his motorbike on the truck and was thrown off onto the side of the road. He broke his neck so he wouldn't be able to walk. But he was flown to the city hospital and died there of internal bleeding.
Not trying to be a dick just pointing out..
1337h4x:

A random person in zimbabwe died in starvation, boohoo, we have to make a new topic and cry about it.

This guy has a point, Thousands of people a day die of hunger, People loved like Jordan.

Again im not trying to be a dick im just pointing it out.

R.I.P Jordan

Read full topic

item.title: Rest In Peace Jordan
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

Bad luck Zandia, I feel for you. Don’t dwell on it though. Get over it, worse shit happens.

Read full topic

item.title: Rest In Peace Jordan
item.dc:creator: @mikkomainer Secet
item.description:
@mikkomainer wrote:

[quote=“bryanc, post:22, topic:142023”][quote author=Secet link=topic=194386.msg1753749#msg1753749 date=1189703583]
I apology if someone got offended for my post, but it was not ment as a joke.

I was just thinking that if he had something like 1000cc bike or maybe even 600cc bike (It’s his first bike, right?), he can only blame himself. I just think it’s plain stupid to jump on big bike if you haven’t got any other bikes before. I remember when I got my first 50cc bike - Oh boy it was fast! I was afraid to use full throttle at the beginning. Then I bought 125cc sportbike - Woah! It felt so fast at the beginning, I used to ride very fast even at the city. But then one day I got busted, I rode about twice as much as speed limit allowed - in middle of city. That really awakened me and couple of days later I started thinking:“That was just fucking stupid”
I’m just saying that if it was his first bike, he can only blame himself. It just stupid to go to difficult roadsections on your first day on bike.

Well, little bit offtopic but I hope I cleared up some things.
Anyways, RIP
[/quote]

Get a life kid, Who cares what kind of bike it was… he is dead. Why you got to be such a dick about it…

Anyways,

Sorry to hear that man, hope you feel better soon. :([/quote]
You really missed my point.

Read full topic

item.title: Rest In Peace Jordan
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Ofcourse he wasn’t trying to be a dick, and I kind of agree with Secet. People make fun off me about being on a “pussy little 85.”
I laugh at them and think too myself “It’s not the size of it, it’s the way you use it.”

Read full topic

item.title: Rest In Peace Jordan
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

I can see where Secet is coming from, there are people who jump straight onto big bikes when they aren’t ready for them, and this is a leading cause of accidents… maybe it wasn’t the best time or place to discuss it, but I don’t think he was trying to be a dick.

Read full topic

item.description:

I respect everyones decision to give the RIP stuff, I however, do not believe in it, I will take into account of your loss but, I will not say or even type RIP for people I haven’t been able to know.
